circumstances: En route from Anacortes to Eastsound Airport (Orcas Island), weather conditions deteriorated. Flying at an insufficient height in low ceiling and fog, the single engine airplane struck trees and crashed. The pilot was injured and the airplane was destroyed.
probable_cause:
Controlled collision with trees in normal cruise due to improper in-flight decisions on part of the pilot who continued VFR flight into adverse weather conditions. The following contributing factors were reported:
- Low ceiling,
- Fog,
- High obstructions.
